intro: Unonopsis pittieri, commonly known as the Pittier's unon, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
